name: Knight Brothers
background:
Battle Brother Detachments are elite battle companies of superhuman warriors with highly specialized training and tactics.
Stranded in the Sirius Sector, the Detachments settled a number of worlds which they have adapted to their unique needs. 

The Detachments changed over time as well, becoming more distinct and developing their own ideas of how best to serve their Founder. Now,  Detachments struggle to maintain a sense of unity and purpose as they become more distinct.
backgroundFull:
Following the genetic innovations of the Founder, the Battle Brothers were soon deployed to maintain unity and peace over Earth and its nearby colonies. Early space travel had proven an expensive and difficult process, and as a result, Battle Brothers were assigned to each colony as a permanent garrison. These garrisons were formed into the first Detachments, serving as their world’s first line of defence against insurgency and civil conflict. 

Detachments rapidly adapted to combat on their respective worlds, developing unique tactics, equipment and roles to excel in localized conflicts. By the time that the first wave of recruits had been fully trained, most Detachments had already developed their own unique culture, skills and traditions, which set them apart from the original Battle Brothers. Many Detachments became symbols of stability and cultural identity on their respective home worlds, gathering respect and political influence as their reputation grew.

At the height of the Detachments’ influence, the Founder revealed his vision of a united and uplifted humanity, capable of thriving throughout the galaxy with the use of advanced gene-mods. In order to overcome political obstacles to his vision, the Founder led a daring coup to seize control of humanity’s colonies. Detachments moved quickly, with some declaring their loyalty to the Founder while others opposed him. This division sparked a long and destructive civil war which soon engulfed all of humanity.

On Earth, the fighting was particularly fierce and some feared that it might leave the world uninhabitable. A portion of humanity chose to flee the situation, commandeering one of the Founder’s fleets. The Founder drew a number of Detachments from the front lines to pursue these refugees, but a massive wormhole left both fleets stranded in the Sirius Sector.

The Battle Brothers moved quickly to establish themselves in the Sirius Sector, with each remaining detachment tasked with gathering their surviving members and settling on a world in order to best achieve the Founder’s vision. Their time in Sirius has given the detachments time to further specialize and hone their skills, building upon their predecessors in new ways. This has fostered a strong sense of independence and even rivalry among a number of detachments, united only by their loyalty to the original Founder and his successors, the Conduits.

How will your detachment adapt to the Sirius Sector?

spells.name: Knight Sight
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 18", which friendly units gets Unstoppable when shooting against once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Knight Trauma
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 18", which takes 1 hit with Smash.

spells.name: Banishing Sigil
spells.effect: Pick up to two enemy units within 18", which get -1 to defense rolls once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: params.thisUnit ? 0 : this.getUnitBaseCostDiff({ quality: 4, defense: 5, tough: 2, rules: ["Tough"] }, { defense: 5 - params.effect.rollModifier.value })

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Doom Strike
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 6", which takes 2 hit with AP(2) and Deadly(3).

spells.name: Knight Dome
spells.effect: Pick up to three friendly units within 12", which get Evasive once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Purge the Impure
spells.effect: Pick up to two enemy units within 12", which take 3 hits with AP(2) each.

specialRules.name: Knightborn
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 6+ it is ignored. If the wounds were from a spell, then they are ignored on a 4+ instead.

specialRules.name: Teleport
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, place this model anywhere fully within 6" of its position.

specialRules.name: Melee Shrouding Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Melee Shrouding.

specialRules.name: Shielded
specialRules.description: Units where all models have this rule get +1 to defense rolls against hits that are not from spells.

specialRules.name: Re-Deployment
specialRules.description: After all other units are deployed (excluding units that were set aside), you may remove up to two friendly units from the table and deploy them again. Players alternate in placing Re-Deployment units, starting with the player that activates next.

specialRules.name: Mend
specialRules.description: Once per activation, pick one friendly model within 3" with Tough, and remove D3 wounds from it.

specialRules.name: Versatile Attack
specialRules.description: When this unit is activated, pick one effect: until the end of the activation all models with this rule in it either get AP(+1) when attacking, or get +1 to hit rolls when attacking.

specialRules.name: Ravage
specialRules.description: When it's this model's turn to attack in melee, roll X dice. For each 6+ the target takes one wound.

specialRules.name: Bane when Shooting Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Bane when shooting.

specialRules.name: Unpredictable Fighter Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Unpredictable Fighter.

specialRules.name: Regeneration Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Regeneration.

specialRules.name: Rapid Rush Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Rapid Rush.

specialRules.name: Bane in Melee Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Bane in melee.

specialRules.name: Smash
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and against units where most models have Defense 5+ to Defense 6+, this weapon gets Blast(+3).

specialRules.name: Unstoppable Shooting Mark
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick one enemy unit within 18", which friendly units gets Unstoppable when shooting against once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Re-Position Artillery
specialRules.description: Once per activation, pick one friendly model within 6" with Artillery, which may immediately move by up to 9".

specialRules.name: Versatile Reach Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Versatile Reach.

specialRules.name: Courage Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get +1 to morale test rolls.

specialRules.name: Melee Shrouding
specialRules.description: Enemies get -3" movement when trying to charge units where all models have this rule.

specialRules.name: Tough
specialRules.description: This model must take X wounds before being killed. If a model with tough joins a unit without it, then it is removed last when the unit takes wounds. You must continue to put wounds on the tough model with most wounds in the unit until it is killed, before starting to put them on the next tough model (heroes must be assigned wounds last, even if already wounded).

specialRules.name: AP
specialRules.description: Targets get -X to Defense rolls when blocking hits.

specialRules.name: Bane
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and when attacking the target must re-roll unmodified Defense results of 6.

specialRules.name: Unpredictable Fighter
specialRules.description: When in melee, roll one die and apply one effect to all models with this rule: on a 1-3 they get AP(+1), and on a 4-6 they get +1 to hit rolls instead.

specialRules.name: Unpredictable
specialRules.description: When attacking, roll one die and apply one effect to all models with this rule: on a 1-3 they get AP(+1), and on a 4-6 they get +1 to hit rolls instead.

specialRules.name: Regeneration
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 5+ it is ignored.

specialRules.name: Rapid Rush
specialRules.description: This model moves +6" when using Rush actions.

specialRules.name: Ignores Regeneration
specialRules.description: This weapon ignores Regeneration.

specialRules.name: Defense
specialRules.description: This model gets +X to defense rolls.

specialRules.name: Blast
specialRules.description: Ignores cover, and after resolving other special rules, each hit is multiplied by X, where X is up to as many hits as models in the target unit.

specialRules.name: Unstoppable
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and ignores all negative modifiers to this weapon.

specialRules.name: Artillery
specialRules.description: May only use Hold actions. When this model shoots at enemies over 9" away, it gets +1 to hit rolls. When enemy units shoot at this model from over 9" away, they get -2 to hit rolls.

specialRules.name: Versatile Reach
specialRules.description: When this unit is activated, pick one effect: until the end of the activation all models with this rule in it either get +4" range when shooting, or move +2" when charging.

specialRules.name: Evasive
specialRules.description: Enemies get -1 to hit rolls when attacking units where all models have this rule.

specialRules.name: Deadly
specialRules.description: Assign each wound to one model, and multiply it by X. Hits from Deadly must be resolved first, and these wounds don’t carry over to other models if the original target is killed.
